class_notes:
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement: -Tradition-Buddhism. 
The course examines the origin and development of Buddhist teachings, practices, and institutions from the fourth century BCE to the present. We will explore the fundamental Buddhist doctrines, such as the four noble truths, middle way, and emptiness, and we will investigate Buddhism in practice in different cultural settings, including in India, East Asia, Tibet, and the West.
course_description: Introduction to the practices, doctrines, literature and institutions of Buddhism, with particular focus on contemplative practices, ethics and methods of philosophical investigation, narrative traditions, and the transformation of Buddhism across cultures.
